definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: She was often heared humming this song.
sentences.chinese: 人們常聽見她哼這首歌。

sentences.english: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 他氣憤地哼了一聲，走開了。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母親正對着嬰兒哼着搖籃曲。

sentences.english: His grandfather noticed that he would often improvise melodies as he played with his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父注意到他在玩玩具時常常即興哼出旋律來。

sentences.english: Lingheng sound of a hand put fireballs fly.
sentences.chinese: 我冷哼一聲，伸手便把火球打飛。

sentences.english: John was humming a tune when he put on his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 約翰一邊穿衣服一邊哼着曲子。

sentences.english: Man, it really pisses me off when people interrupt me like that.
sentences.chinese: 哼，如果我被別人那樣打斷的話，我就會特別生氣。

sentences.english: Penguins, ahem, are black and white.

sentences.chinese: 他不太相信地哼了一聲。

sentences.english: Hum, world strange treasure, ability get it.
Hum, the younger sister, was fishing.
sentences.chinese: 哼，這個妹妹，真會乘人之危。

sentences.english: Later, you will be holding your hand, humming a song.
sentences.chinese: 以後，你會牽着誰的手，哼着怎樣的歌。

sentences.english: It's strange that he (should) leave without a word.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是他竟然一聲不哼地走了。

sentences.english: But stop and loiter all the time, to sing it in extatic songs.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾懶了遊蕩而已，哼着歌曲說說夢囈。

sentences.english: When I told her what had happened she just grunted and turned back to her book.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴她出了什麼事，她只哼了一聲就又看起書來了。

sentences.english: I croon this poem in delight.

definition: to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
to cast sidelong glances at sb
